medical_history.chief_complaint: Sharp abdominal pain radiating to the back, most prominent in the left upper quadrant (LUQ) and right upper quadrant (RUQ).
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient presents with a 1-day history of abdominal pain that occurred suddenly yesterday. The pain has not improved and feels similar to past experiences when passing a gallstone, but this time it is worse.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Chronic fatigue syndrome, cholelithiasis, allergic rhinitis, previous tonsillectomy, left renal cyst, hepatic angioma.
medical_history.family_history: Mother: COPD, lung cancer, gallstones; Father: hypertension, dementia, colon polyps.
